extensionName.message: Forget Me Not - Forget cookies & other data

extensionDescription.message: Make the browser forget website data, except for the data you want to keep.

rule_dialog_content.message:
- **N**ever: No cleaning.
- On **S**tartup: Clean only on browser start.
- On **L**eave: Clean on domain leave and on browser start.
- **I**nstantly: Prevent data from being set, if possible. Otherwise behave like `On Leave`.

**\*** For `On Leave` and `On Startup` to work, the respective cleanup options must be enabled. Some limitations might apply due to restrictions in the Web-Extension API. [Read more](readme.html#tutorial)

rule_dialog_temporary.message: Temporary rule: Remove this rule on domain leave or browser restart.

confirm_rule_replace_dialog_content.message: The specified rule expression already exists.. do you want to replace it?

cookie_browser_description.message: With this you can inspect cookies and easily add cookie-specific rules.

manual_cleanup_description.message: With this you can run a manual clean up. You will be able to select what to clean.

toggle_snooze_description.message:
In snooze mode, these cleanups will be prevented:
- Cleanup on domain leave
- Cleanup of third-party cookies
- Blocking of cookies

All missed cleanups will be rescheduled once you stop snooze mode.

help_button@title.message: Read about how rules work, what expressions you can use, experimental features, and recent changes in this extension.

types_of_cleanup@title.message: Read more about what exactly these checkboxes clean.

setting_purge_expired_cookies.message: Purge expired cookies whenever a cleanup happens.

setting_show_update_notification.message: Show a notification when the extension has been updated.

setting_show_cookie_removal_notification.message: Show a notification when cookies have been removed.

setting_show_badge.message: Show matching rule as a badge on the toolbar button

setting_protect_open_domains.message: Protect currently open domains if "Apply Rules" is checked

setting_delay_domain_leave_cleanup_in_se.message: Delay for domain leave cleanup in seconds:

setting_whitelist_no_tld.message: Never clean domains without a Top Level Domain

setting_whitelist_no_tld@title.message: Domains like localhost, intranet, etc. (without .com, .net, etc.)

setting_whitelist_file_system.message: Never run cleanup on files from your computer

settings_fallback_rule.message: Cleanup if no expression matches (default: On Leave):

setting_experimental_info.message: These are experimental features. Read more about them [here](readme.html#experimental).

setting_initialTab.message: Initially selected tab on this popup:

update_notification_title.message: Forget Me Not has been updated!

update_notification_message.message: Click here to see what's new.

import_by_drop_or_click.message: Import settings by dropping a previously exported file in this area or clicking anywhere to select such a file.

import_success_close_now.message: Imported settings successfully. You can close this window now.

import_failure.message: Could not import file. Check if the file is a valid settings file.

about_page.message:
## Author
Made by Santo Pfingsten, © 2017-2019

## Translators Needed

If you know another language well enough, you can help by creating a translation with [this nifty web-app](https://lusito.github.io/web-ext-translator/?gh=https://github.com/lusito/forget-me-not/tree/develop).


## Problems, questions and other feedback
Please report issues and feature requests on GitHub:  
[https://github.com/Lusito/forget-me-not/issues](https://github.com/Lusito/forget-me-not/issues)

## Privacy Statement

Your privacy is of the utmost importance.
This extension does not analyze or collect anything beyond what it needs to fulfill its duty. It does not send any data anywhere not even anonymously. PERIOD.

## Credits
* English translation written by Santo Pfingsten
* [Myosotis flower cartoon 1](https://www.vexels.com/vectors/preview/136467/myosotis-flower-cartoon-1) |   Designed by Vexels.com
* Icons made by [Google](https://www.flaticon.com/authors/google "Google")  from [www.flaticon.com](https://www.flaticon.com/ "Flaticon") is licensed by [CC 3.0 BY](http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/ "Creative Commons BY 3.0")

tutorial_page.message:
# Introduction Tutorial

## Firefox settings
Please note, that this extension has no access to your Firefox settings, so any cookie settings you make in Firefox itself will be combined with this extension.

So if you configure Firefox to deny all cookies, this extension will have no cookies to work with.

## Cleanup Types
You can configure cleanup rules that match certain domain names (host names of a website, like *google.com*). Possible cleanup types are:

- **Never**: No cleanup will be performed for domains matching this rule.
- **On Startup**: Cleanup will run on browser start.
- **On Leave**: Cleanup will be run when you leave a domain (by entering a new one into the url-bar or by closing the tab)
- **Instantly**: If possible, cookies will be prevented from being set. Otherwise they will be removed almost instantly.

If multiple rules match a domain, the most important rule will be selected. Currently this is defined as: `Instantly > On Leave > Never > On Startup`.

If no rule matches a domain, the fallback rule will be used.


## Valid expressions
- Every hostname (e.g. www.google.com) is a valid expression.
- An asterisk (*) can be used as placeholder for a segment (e.g. *.google.com or www.\*.com).

### Cookie specific expressions
You can create rules for cookiename and domain combinations.
- Example: `cookiename@*.google.com`
- `cookiename` can be any valid cookie name.
- The same rules, as seen above, apply for the domain specific part to the right of the `@` sign.
- Cookie specific rules are always preferred over normal rules.

## Third party cookies
- When a cookie is set without belonging to a domain which is open in a tab, it is considered a third-party cookie.
- Research is being done to improve this method.

## Snooze Mode

With the "Snooze Mode", you can temporarily disable automatic cleanup. Hover the icon for instructions (or click on it if you are on android).

## Types of data to clean up

You can choose which data to cleanup:
- **Cookies**: Normal HTTP cookies. (Flash cookies are covered by "Plugin Data").
- **Local Storage** and **Indexed DB**: Websites can store data on your browser to allow certain features or to remember something for the next visit.
Sometimes Firefox refers to *Indexed DB* as "Storage", so if Firefox tells you, that youtube.com uses some MB of Storage, it is probably *Indexed DB*.
- **History**: This contains a log of all your website visits.
- **Downloads**: This contains the history of your downloads. Cleaning downloads does not remove the files on your disk.
- **Form Data**: At some point you might have entered information in (for example) a contact or billing form. Depending on your settings, this might have been saved, so it's easier for you to re-enter these values.
- **Passwords**: You might have told Firefox to remember certain passwords. Choose this to remove them again.
- **Plugin Data**: Plugins (not add-ons/web-extensions) like Adobe Flash or Acrobat Reader might store data like Flash cookies or other information & settings.
- **Service Workers**: Service Workers are a way to allow Websites to be used offline and also help to speed up loading web-apps that make use of this.
- **Server Bound Certificates**: If you added certificates to allow connections to a server, then this is the option to clear it with.

experimental_page.message:
## Experimental Features

- From time to time there will be new features which are marked as experimental.
- They will be disabled by default and need to be manually enabled.
- These features are used to evaluate new ways to improve the extension.
- They might be unstable or have bad performance.
- If you experience issues, try turning these features off.
- Please submit feedback and bug reports on [GitHub](https://github.com/Lusito/forget-me-not/issues)

## Currently active experiments:
- **Purge Expired Cookies**:
Whenever a cleanup happens, cookies that have an expiration date set in the past will be removed regardless of the configured rules. Normally Firefox only deletes expired cookies when a certain limit is hit. Those cookies would not get send to the website, but they would still be there. This option will help removing these ghosting cookies.
- **Deny Third-Party Cookies**:  
If enabled, every web request will be intercepted to remove cookies from domains which don't belong to the tabs URL and are not protected by a rule. So these cookies will never be set.

Please give me feedback on your experience with these experiments, so I can decide whether or not to add them permanently.

changelog_page.message:
## Changelog

### Version 2.2.4 (2019/06/30)

- Instantly rules (and the deny third-party option) are now affected by snooze mode as well.

### Version 2.2.3 (2019/06/24)

- Updated pt-BR translations by Fábio M.
- Using new filter on Firefox >= 68 to ignore incognito tabs when blocking cookies.

### Version 2.2.2 (2019/04/14)

- German Swiss translation removed, as Firefox doesn't support it.
- A bug causing performance issues has been fixed.
- The cookie browser now refreshes after a rule has been added.

### Version 2.2.1 (2019/03/13)

- Translations have been updated.
- A bug in the cookie browser has been fixed.

### Version 2.2.0 (2019/03/12)

- Swiss German translations have been updated.
- A cookie browser has been added to easily add cookie-specific rules.

### Version 2.1.0 (2019/03/03)

- Further improvements to the user interface.
- Fix for downloads not being cleared correctly on startup
- Fix for input field on rule creation.
- Swiss German translation by BenjaminRosenzeig.
- Updated italian translation by AlienLogic.
- Fix for "Instant" rule incorrectly blocking in private tabs.
- Added missing tooltips.
- Cookie expressions are now shown under the "Matching Expression"

### Version 2.0.0 (2019/02/17)

- Improved and simplified the user interface.
- Rule names have changed to better reflect what they stand for.
- Tutorials, descriptions, etc. have been adapted to be more clear.
- Android does not support all cleanup types.. the new UI now shows what features are missing.
- New translation have been added: French (Benny Hill, djizuss) and Catalan (Lakatoi).
- Delay values can now be entered in seconds instead of minutes.
- Frames are now taken into account to improve cleanups.
- Fixed a rare issue with with the cookie blocking logic.
- Blocked cookies will now produce "removed" notifications as well.
- It's now possible to clean cache.
- Downloads and history can now apply rules and thus also run on domain leave.
- Code has been heavily rewritten for improved stability.
- A ton of unit tests have been added to ensure the logic works flawlessly: Now counting 335 tests!

### Version 1.0.5 (2018/09/02)
- Fixed a bug causing the update notification to appear on every start.

### Version 1.0.4 (2018/09/02)
- Workaround for Firefox bug, which doesn't clear download history.
- Workaround for Firefox bug preventing container cookies to be cleaned correctly
- Local cookies (from websites stored on your computer) can now be cleared as well.
- Italian translation written by temptemptmp.
- Support for the live apply button of the web-extension-translator.
- Better support for Firefox overflow menu

### Version 1.0.3 (2018/08/23)
- Fix a bug in the rule expression parser
- Spanish (Argentina) translation written by [Fabián Pérez](https://www.github.com/thepante)
- Swedish translation written by Jo3yA
- Portuguese translation written by SW1FT
- Portuguese(Brazil) translation written by Victor Bambino
- Updated upper and lower sorbian translation written by Michael Wolf

### Version 1.0.2 (2018/06/03)
- Support for keyboard navigation and screen readers

### Version 1.0.1 (2018/05/28)
- Fix for purging expired cookies

### Version 1.0.0 (2018/05/27)
- Added a different icon and tooltip in snooze mode.
- Upper and Lower Sorbian locales thanks to @milupo.
- Users can now change what rule-type is applied if no matching rule was found.
- Support for creating rules specific to a named cookie
- Improved detection of third-party cookies.
- Fixed bugs with subdomain cookie removal.
- Improved support for First Party Isolation
- New experimental feature: Purging expired cookies whenever a cleanup happens.
- Fixed some visual issues.
- Lots of code improvements for better stability and improved performance!
- Over 100 unit tests to ensure good quality!
- Better help and more descriptions.
- Added privacy statement.

### Version 0.9.1 (2018/04/06)
- Bug that ignored the -do not notify about updates- setting

### Version 0.9.0 (2018/03/24)
- Added settings to disable or limit the domain log
- Support for displaying punycode domain names
- Fixed cookies not being removed properly in some cases
- Using icons instead of titles in the tabs of the popup
- Allow the manual cleanup to ignore the "protect open domains" rule.
- Added a snooze feature to temporarily disable automatic cleanup. The cleanups will be rescheduled once the snooze has been stopped.
- Technology upgrade

### Version 0.8.8 (2018/01/24)
- Added new black rule type to block cookies completely.
- First Party Isolation no longer prevents the extension from removing cookies (starts working with Firefox 59). Improved support will be made available in a beta version soon.
- Bugfix: When leaving a domain, re-entering and leaving it again before the original cleanup timeout passed, cookies would be deleted too early.
- Bugfix: Notifications could get replaced too quickly for the user to see.

### Version 0.8.7 (2017/12/20)
- Workaround for settings  import not working correctly in the Firefox browserAction popup.
- Partial support for container tabs: Cookies work, local storage does not (Mozilla needs to fix something first)
- Added new rule "Forget" (red) to allow overriding other rules (read the tutorial for details).
- Fixed an issue with startup cleanup
- Added unit tests
- Added option to hide badges
- Added option to chose the initially selected tab
- Added option to show cookie removal notifications
- Fixed issue on export

### Version 0.8.6 (2017/12/06)
- Translation changes, using [web-ext-translator](https://www.npmjs.com/package/web-ext-translator)
- Introduction of an in-extension readme, tutorial and changelog.
  - This can be accessed through the questionmark button.
- Showing a notification when the extension has been updated (can be disabled).
- Domains without a Top Level Domain (like localhost, intranet, etc.) can now be whitelisted with a checkbox.
- Experimental feature for blocking third-party cookies

### Version 0.8.5 (2017/11/25)
- Typo fixed
- Made toggle of rule type smoother
- Button for adding new rules (before you could only add a new rule by pressing enter)
- Button for getting information on valid expressions 

### Version 0.8.4 (2017/11/25)
- Better mobile compatibility
- Fix for incognito cookies being logged and removed 

### Version 0.8.3 (2017/11/24)
- Disabled on incognito tabs/windows
- Added a log to see the domains of recent cookie changes
- Added buttons to prefill the filter input field with domains of the above and the current tab

### Version 0.8.2 (2017/11/19)
- Some bugfixes, cleanups 

### Version 0.8.0 (2017/11/19)
- First Version
